responses: The movie 'Psycho' was the first American film to show a toilet flushing.
In 'The Matrix', the iconic green code is actually symbols from a sushi recipe.

Tom Hanks improvised many of the famous lines in 'Forrest Gump'.
The roar of the T-Rex in 'Jurassic Park' is a mix of dog, penguin, and alligator sounds.

responses: A day on Venus is longer than a year on Venus.
Neutron stars are so dense that a sugar-cube-sized amount would weigh a billion tons.
There are more stars in the universe than grains of sand on Earth.
Jupiter has a storm, the Great Red Spot, that has been raging for over 300 years.
The footprints on the moon will stay there for millions of years because there is no wind to erase them.

patterns: Tell me a fun fact about technology
Do you know any tech trivia?
I want to learn something about computers
responses: The first computer virus was created in 1986 and was called 'Brain'.
The first 1GB hard drive, introduced in 1980, weighed over 500 pounds.
Did you know that more than 90% of the world’s data was generated in the past two years?
The first email was sent by Ray Tomlinson to himself in 1971.
Over 6,000 new computer viruses are created and released every month.

patterns: Tell me a fun fact about history
Do you know any historical trivia?
I want to learn something about history
responses: Napoleon Bonaparte was once attacked by a horde of rabbits.
Abraham Lincoln was a licensed bartender before becoming president.
The Eiffel Tower can grow more than six inches during summer due to heat expansion.
The shortest war in history was between Britain and Zanzibar on August 27, 1896. It lasted only 38 minutes.
Ancient Egyptians used honey as an antibiotic.

patterns: Tell me a fun fact about food
Do you know any food trivia?
I want to learn something about cuisine
responses: Honey never spoils. Archaeologists have found pots of honey in ancient Egyptian tombs that are over 3,000 years old and still edible.
Apples float in water because they are 25% air.
The world’s most expensive pizza costs over $12,000 and takes 72 hours to prepare.
White chocolate isn’t actually chocolate because it doesn’t contain cocoa solids.
Peanuts aren’t nuts—they’re legumes.

patterns: Tell me a fun fact about music
Do you know any music trivia?
I want to learn something about songs
responses: The longest piano piece in the world is 'As Slow As Possible', and it will take 639 years to perform.
A single violin is made from over 70 individual pieces of wood.
In 2016, Mozart sold more CDs than Beyoncé.
The most expensive musical instrument ever sold was a Stradivarius violin for $15.9 million.
The first music video played on MTV was 'Video Killed the Radio Star' by The Buggles.

patterns: Tell me a fun fact about sports
Do you know any sports trivia?
I want to learn something about games
responses: The Olympic Games were originally a religious festival held in honor of Zeus.
The longest tennis match lasted over 11 hours across three days at Wimbledon 2010.
Golf is the only sport to have been played on the moon.
Michael Phelps has won more Olympic gold medals than 161 countries.
A baseball has exactly 108 stitches.
